content.text: 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat" )

content.text: 1 cup chicken broth
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 cup chicken broth" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon salt
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1/2 teaspoon salt" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper" )

content.text: 1 1/2 cups milk
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "1 1/2 cups milk" )

content.text: 3 tablespoons butter
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "3 tablespoons butter" )

content.text: 1 onion, chopped
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 onion, chopped" )

content.text: 1 cup chopped celery
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1 cup chopped celery" )

content.text: 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "1/3 cup all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
content.eamr: ( ing-9 "2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
content.eamr: ( ing-10 "1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
content.eamr: ( ing-11 "1/2 teaspoon dried thyme" )

content.text: 1 (9 inch) pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie
content.eamr: ( ing-12 "1 (9 inch) pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie" )

content.text: 1 egg, lightly beaten
content.eamr: ( ing-13 "1 egg, lightly beaten" )

content.text: 0) In a large saucepan over medium high heat, combine the chicken meat, chicken broth, salt and pepper.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "combine"@46:53 / AC
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a large saucepan"@6:22 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-0-0 "medium high heat"@28:44 / TEMPERATURE )
		:ppt ( ing-0 "the chicken meat"@54:70 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "chicken broth"@72:85 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "salt"@87:91 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "pepper"@96:102 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low.
2) Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "Cover and let simmer"@17:23 / AC
		:duration ( dur-2-0 "30 minutes"@28:38 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-2-0 "until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear"@43:113 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Remove the chicken and let cool.
4) Pour the remaining chicken broth mixture into a measuring cup.
5) Let stand; spoon off fat.
6) Add enough milk to the broth mixture to equal 2 1/2 cups.
7) Cut chicken into 1/2 inch pieces.
8) In the same pan, melt butter or margarine over medium heat.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
	:inform ( ac-8-0 "melt"@20:24 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-5 "butter or margarine"@25:31 / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-8-0 "medium heat"@50:61 / TEMPERATURE )
		:loc ( tool-8-0 "the same pan"@6:18 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 9) Add the onion and celery.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Add"@-1:-1 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "the onion"@-1:-1 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "celery"@-1:-1 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 10) Saute, stirring, for 3 minutes.
11) Stir in flour until well blended.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "Stir in"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-8 "flour"@12:17 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-11-0 "until well blended"@18:36 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Gradually stir in broth mixture.
13) Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and boils.
14) Add the chicken, vegetables, parsley and thyme.
content.eamr:
( inst-14 / R
	:inform ( ac-14-0 "Add"@4:7 / AC
		:ppt ( "the chicken"@8:19 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "vegetables"@21:31 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "parsley"@33:40 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-11 "thyme"@45:50 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 15) Pour mixture into a 1 1/2 quart deep casserole dish.
16) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-16 / R
	:inform ( ac-16-0 "Preheat"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-16-0 "oven"@12:16 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-16-0 "400 degrees F"@20:33 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-16-1 "200 degrees C"@35:48 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 17) Roll out pastry 1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish on a lightly floured surface.
content.eamr:
( inst-17 / R
	:inform ( ac-17-0 "Roll out"@4:12 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-12 "pastry"@13:19 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-17-0 "a lightly floured surface"@77:102 / TOOL )
		:reshape ( "1 inch larger than the diameter of the casserole dish"@20:73 / OTHER )
	)
)

content.text: 18) Cut slits in the pastry for venting air.
content.eamr:
( inst-18 / R
	:inform ( ac-18-0 "Cut"@4:7 / AC
		:prp ( purp-18-0 "for venting air"@28:43 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( "slits"@8:13 / OTHER )
		:source ( "the pastry"@17:27 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 19) Place pastry on top of casserole.
20) Roll edges and cut away extra pastry; flute edges by pinching together.
21) Brush pastry with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling.
content.eamr:
( inst-21 / R
	:inform ( ac-21-0 "Brush"@4:9 / AC
		:gol ( "pastry"@10:16 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-13 "beaten egg"@22:32 / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-21-1 "bake"@37:41 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-21-0 "the preheated oven"@45:63 / TOOL )
		:duration ( dur-21-0 "30 minutes"@68:78 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-21-0 "until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling"@82:141 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 22) Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.
